content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```About Myself: I have a very high level of mathematical knowledge up to the post-graduate level.  I also have a keen interest in graduate level theoretical physics.

These are my current research areas or areas of study:
(1) coding: mainly Python
(2) mathematics up to graduate level and research level
(3) machine learning and artificial intelligence```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```- When writing machine learning code in Python, use Pytorch unless there are strong compelling reasons for using another library.

- Make sure all Python code is compatible with Python version 3.11.```

user_context_message_data.about_user_message:
About Myself: I have a very high level of mathematical knowledge up to the post-graduate level.  I also have a keen interest in graduate level theoretical physics.

These are my current research areas or areas of study:
(1) coding: mainly Python
(2) mathematics up to graduate level and research level
(3) machine learning and artificial intelligence
user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
- When writing machine learning code in Python, use Pytorch unless there are strong compelling reasons for using another library.

- Make sure all Python code is compatible with Python version 3.11.

parts:
Put the following citations in APA format: Citations:
[1] https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/nric-numbers-masking-bizfile-acra-mddi-government-public-education-pdpa-4804801
[2] https://www.mddi.gov.sg/mddi-s-reply-to-media-queries-on-disclosure-of-nric-number-on-bizfile-system/
[3] https://www.theonlinecitizen.com/2024/12/14/why-has-mddi-reversed-its-position-on-nric-numbers-as-sensitive-data/
[4] https://www.singaporelawwatch.sg/Headlines/as-agencies-apologise-over-nric-confusion-concerns-over-scam-risk-and-privacy-loss-remain-opinion
[5] https://www.pdpc.gov.sg/-/media/Files/PDPC/DPO-Connect/July-19/Gearing-Up-For-Sept-1-When-NRIC-Guidelines-Kick-In
[6] https://www.singaporelawwatch.sg/Headlines/nric-numbers-may-not-be-secure-enough-for-authentication-purposes-but-how-will-companies-adapt
[7] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XoTtddXBRmk
[8] https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/pdpc-nric-numbers-personal-data-protection-4807096
[9] https://www.theonlinecitizen.com/2024/12/14/government-reveals-acra-moved-ahead-of-plans-on-unmasking-nric-numbers-in-response-to-privacy-concerns/

Here are the citations formatted in APA style:

1. Channel NewsAsia. (2024, December 14). Govt plans to stop masking NRIC numbers, apologises for ACRA publishing details in search results before public education. https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/nric-numbers-masking-bizfile-acra-mddi-government-public-education-pdpa-4804801

2. Ministry of Digital Development and Information. (2024, December 13). MDDI’s reply to media queries on disclosure of NRIC number on BizFile system. https://www.mddi.gov.sg/mddi-s-reply-to-media-queries-on-disclosure-of-nric-number-on-bizfile-system/

3. The Online Citizen. (2024, December 14). Why has MDDI reversed its position on NRIC numbers as sensitive data? https://www.theonlinecitizen.com/2024/12/14/why-has-mddi-reversed-its-position-on-nric-numbers-as-sensitive-data/

4. Singapore Law Watch. (2024, December 16). As agencies apologise over NRIC confusion, concerns over scam risk and privacy loss remain: Opinion. https://www.singaporelawwatch.sg/Headlines/as-agencies-apologise-over-nric-confusion-concerns-over-scam-risk-and-privacy-loss-remain-opinion

5. Personal Data Protection Commission. (2019, July). Gearing
